summary: The contact owns a 2016 Ram 3500. The contact stated after purchasing the vehicle, the local dealer informed him about NHTSA Campaign Number: 19V021000 (Steering) however, the part to do the recall repair was not yet available. The dealer stated informed the contact that the nut would be welded and the vehicle would need an alignment. The contact stated that the steering wheel was not completely straight. The contact took the vehicle to an independent mechanic and who was unable to align the vehicle due to an issue with the drag link. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was not made aware of the failure. The failure mileage was 68,190.

My 2016 dodge ram 3500 mega cab had a light come on the dash at about 89000 miles I drove it to the dealership, I told the dealership I thought it was something electrical. A couple of times my truck has went into limp mode, when this happens to you the truck will only take off in 4th gear and stays in 4th gear. If I pulled over when this would happen and turned the truck all the way off and then back on it take the light of the dash and shift properly. So the dealership calls me to let me know what they have found he says he has bad news and more bad news which was my transmission was going out and then they didn't have a transmission and had no idea when they would. They already welded up nut on the steering shaft instead of replacing it. I didnt buy a 3500 pickup because i wanted a light duty truck.

On February 3, 2022 I had my truck serviced at my local dealership to address SAFETY RECALL  Y26. According to the service manager, the work was completed per the Safety Recall instructions. On Feb 22, 2022 while traveling at highway speed, all eight wheel studs broke on the left rear dually wheels which led to the wheel/tires separating from the vehicle without warning. This catastrophic failure could have caused serious injury, or death to the occupants of the vehicle, as well as other motorists/pedestrians. It was by the GRACE OF GOD the driver was able to maintain control of the vehicle until it was safely off the highway. The vehicle was transported by a flatbed wrecker to a dealership near the final destination it was en-route to, to inspect the damage and make all necessary repairs. Both the dealership that performed,  the SAFETY RECALL Y26 in Raleigh, NC and the dealer in Ocala, FL that currently has possession of the truck have confirmed the cause of this catastrophic failure is YIELDED WHEEL STUDS. Consumer is requesting a recall investigation of the previously announced Recall Y26 and adjustment of existing recall remedies.  Consumer has requested the return of all damaged parts from the vehicle from the dealership that is in possession of the vehicle and performing the Safety Recall repairs.

I was driving home, my truck began to vibrate or wobble hard, next thing it begins staggering upon a jolt, and then I noticed my two rear drivers side tires passing me on the highway. I safely get out of traffic somehow, and upon inspection both tires came off, and all my lug nuts but one are missing.  There was no warning, I had to call a tow truck to pick my vehicle up and bring it home , it cannot be repaired due to the manufactory is not sure what the specs are, mean while I am without a vehicle and have missed several days of work.

The contact owns a 2016 Ram 3500. The contact stated that after starting the vehicle with the brake pedal depressed, while attempting to shift into gear, the gear shifter handle fractured. The cause of the failure was not determined. The local dealer was contacted, and the part was replaced by the contact. The vehicle was later serviced under the NHTSA Campaign Number: 17V821000 (Power Train). The contact indicated that an addendum card was to be given as part of the recall repair with instructions to drivers on how to shift gears when the brake pedal was depressed however, the card was not given. Neither the dealer nor the manufacturer would supply the card. The failure mileage was 55,390.

WHEN ACCELERATING FROM A FULL STOP, THE TRUCK ACCELERATES FOR LESS THAN ONE SECOND. AFTER THE SHORT BURST OF ACCELERATION, IT STOPS EVEN THOUGH THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION HAS NOT CHANGED.  THERE IS NOW ZERO ACCELERATION FOR ONE TO THREE SECONDS, LEAVING THE TRUCK IN A POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS POSITION.  THE ACCELERATION COMES BACK WITHIN ONE TO THREE SECONDS AND THE TRUCK DRIVES NORMALLY AFTER THAT.  WHEN YOU COME TO A FULL STOP AT A STOP LIGHT OR STOP SIGN, THE BEHAVIOR REPEATS AND THE DELAY SEEMS TO DECREASE AS THE TRUCK 'WARMS UP'. THIS BEHAVIOR WAS VERIFIED BY TWO DRIVERS AND MULTIPLE TECHNICIANS AT A LOCAL DEALERSHIP WHO ARE UNABLE TO IDENTIFY THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM BUT RECOGNIZE THE POTENTIAL DANGER THAT CAN BE CAUSED BY THE PROBLEM.  THE DEALER HAS HAD THE TRUCK FOR ALMOST ONE MONTH TRYING TO SOLVE AND CONTINUE TO VERIFY THE EXISTENCE AND DANGER ASSOCIATED WITH THE ISSUE.  CHRYSLER'S STAR TEAM HAS ALSO BEEN WORKING WITH THE DEALERSHIP FOR THE ENTIRE MONTH AND A ROOT CAUSE HAS STILL NOT BEEN IDENTIFIED.

I APPLAUD YOUR WORK IN HOLDING AUTOMAKERS ACCOUNTABLE AND RESPONSIBLE FOR FIXING VEHICLE SAFETY ISSUES.  HOWEVER, MY VEHICLE WAS RECALLED FOR V06/NHTSA 19V-021 (STEERING SYSTEM RECALL).  RATHER THAT PROVIDING NEW PARTS FOR THE DEFECTIVE PARTS, RAM STATES THAT NHTSA HAS APPROVED WELDING THE STEERING JAM NUTS TO THE ADJUSTER.  THE DEALER SUBMITTED A STAR CASE (#101582875) TO HAVE REPAIR PARTS PROVIDED WHICH WAS DENIED, BASED ON NHTSA APPROVAL OF WELDING.  ALSO, CALLED RAM CARE (CASE # 68052515) THEY REFUSED TO PROVIDE REPAIR PARTS AND DIRECTED ME TO CONTACT THEIR FCA HQS VIA STANDARD MAIL.  IT IS APPALLING TO ME THAT WE HAVE HEAVY DUTY TRUCKS ON THE ROAD THAT COST OVER $60K AND RATHER THAT REQUIRING RAM TO REPLACE DEFECTIVE PARTS, WE ALLOW THEM TO WELD PARTS.  MOST OF THESE HEAVY DUTY TRUCKS ARE USED TO HAUL HEAVY TRAILERS.  WELDS IF NOT DONE PROPERLY WEAKEN METAL AND CAN BREAK UNDER STRESS.  ADDITIONALLY, THIS FIX (WELDING) RENDERS STEERING SYSTEM ADJUSTMENTS INOPERABLE WITHOUT GRINDING THE WELD ADJUSTING THE STEERING AND RE-WELDING THE PART ALL OF WHICH DAMAGES AND STRESSES THE CRITICAL EXISTING STEERING PARTS.  REQUEST THAT NHTSA REQUIRE RAM TO REPLACE THE DEFECTIVE STEERING PARTS AND NOT ALLOW A JAM NUT TO THE ADJUSTER WELD AS A PERMANENT FIX TO THE STEERING SAFETY RECALL.  THANKS

ON 8/21/2019 I EXPERIENCED EXCESSIVE VIBRATION & TRUCK PULLING TO THE RIGHT TRAVELING NORMAL HWY SPEED. ISSUE WAS SO SEVERE, I STOPPED TO CHECK. TIRES LOOKED FINE  & PRESSURES WERE OK.RETURN TRIP WAS WORSE WITH MAX SPEED OF 35MPH. NEXT DAY I TOOK THE TRUCK TO AN INDEPENDENT TIRE CENTER & WAS TOLD THAT THE BELTS INTHE FRONT TIRES WERE SEPARATING. TIRES ARE NEXEN ROADIAN HTX   LT235/80/R17.THEY ARE ORIGINAL TIRES WITH ONLY 8,010 MILES ON THEM. I CONTACTED RAM THRU THEIR WEBSITE. GOT NO RESPONSE. EMAILED  THE DEALERSHIP WHERE I BOUGHT  THE TRUCK. NO RESPONSE. I CALLED NEXEN & WAS TOLD  THAT THE WARRANTY ONLY COVERED TREAD WEAR. THEY WERE NOT CONCERNED ABOUT THE SEPARATION.THEY EMAILED A PACKET OF INFORMATION THAT THEY WOULD NEED TO INVESTIGATE MY ISSUE. THEY ALSO ADVISED ME TO CHANGE THE TIRES ASAP BECAUSE ONCE I NOTIFIED THEM OF THE PROBLEM, THEY WERE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGES OR INJURIES.I CALLED THE NEAREST RAM DEALERSHIP AND ASKED IF THEY COULD CHECK IT OUT. THE BEST THEY COULD DO WAS SCHEDULE AN APPT IN TWO WEEKS. SINCE I COULD NOT SAFELY DRIVE THE TRUCK, I REPLACED ALL SIX NEXEN TIRES ON 8/27/2019 AT A COST OF OVER $1,800. THAT TIRE CENTER ALSO CONFIRMED A PROBLEM WITH THE TIRES. I FINALLY HEARD FROM FCA. THEY CREATED A CASE # AND ASKED THAT I MAKE AN APPT AT A DEALERSHIP SO THEY COULD INVESTIGATE. I ASSUMED FCA WAS GOING TO CONTACT THE DEALERSHIP SINCE THEY ASK FOR THE APPT INFO. DROVE 60 MILES TO THE DEALERSHIP WHERE WE BOUGHT THE TRUCK. THEY KNEW NOTHING ABOUT THE ISSUE. FCA DID NOT CONTACT THEM. IN FACT THEY CLOSED MY CASE AS SOON AS THEY CONFIRMED THE APPT. BOTTOMLINE, THESE TIRES ARE DANGEROUS. THERE ARE MULTIPLE COMPLAINTS ON THE VARIOUS FORUMS FOR TIRES AND TRUCKS. RAM DOESN'T CARE. FIATCHRYSLER DOESN'T CARE. NEXEN DOESN'T CARE. I'M HOPING YOU DO. I'VE DRIVEN LOTS OF VEHICLES IN MY TIME, I WAS SCARED DRIVING ON THOSE TIRES AND LUCKY TO GET HOME.

GENTLEMEN,   THIS COMPLAINT IS IN REGARDS TO THE CURRENT V06 RECALL THAT AFFECTS RAM HEAVY DUTY TRUCKS. THE CURRENT FIX OF WELDING COMPONENTS OF THE STEERING SYSTEM BY UNCERTIFIED PEOPLE IN AN UNCONTROLLED ENVIRONMENT IS SOMEWHAT CONCERNING. VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED NEW WITH THE MANUAL SINGLE ZONE HEATING VENTILATION AND AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM (HVAC). THE VEHICLE CONSTANTLY DEFAULTS TO RECIRCULATE AIR MODE REGARDLESS OF THE RECIRCULATE MODE BEING TURNED OFF. YOU CAN TELL THE SYSTEM IS IN RECIRC MODE WITH THE RECIRC LIGHT OFF BY THE INCREASED FAN NOISE. THE SYSTEM ALSO DEFAULTS TO RECIRC MODE WHEN THE SYSTEM IS OFF. I HAVE DUPLICATED THE DEFECT TO DEALERSHIP PERSONNEL ON THREE DIFFERENT OCCASIONS WHO ATTEMPTED TO REPAIR THE SYSTEM TO NO AVAIL. THEY THEN DUPLICATED THE EVENT IN A 2018 MODEL RAM PICKUP WITH THE SAME MANUAL HVAC SYSTEM. AFTER THIS I WAS ADVISED IT WAS A DESIGN DEFECT AND THERE WAS NOTHING FURTHER THEY COULD DO.     I BELIEVE THIS IS A SAFETY DEFECT WHICH COULD UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES ALLOW A DANGEROUS BUILDUP OF CARBON MONOXIDE INSIDE THE VEHICLE. THE OPERATOR HAS NO WAY OF KNOWING THAT THEY ARE NOT GETTING FRESH OUTSIDE AIR INTO THE VEHICLE BECAUSE THE RECIRC LIGHT IS OFF WHEN THIS OCCURS.     THIS HAPPENS WHEN THE VEHICLE IS BOTH STATIONARY OR MOVING.

INSTALLED A NORTHERN TOOL GRAVITY FED AUXILIARY DIESEL FUEL TANK FOR DIESEL TRUCK. WORKED GREAT FOR ALMOST A YEAR.  ALL OF A SUDDEN WHEN COMING TO A STOP, NOTICED DIESEL FUEL POURING OUT OF FILLER TUBE. THE 2016 RAM 3500 DIESEL DOES NOT COME WITH A FUEL CAP AND RELIES ON VALVE IN FILLER TUBE TO PREVENT FUEL COMING UP, USUALLY IN A WARM DAY SITUATION. WITH WEAKENED VALVE, AND USING GRAVITY FED AUXILIARY FUEL TANK, RAM TRUCK CAN CREATE SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARD. THE ONLY WAY TO ELIMINATE HAZARD WITH FUEL IN AUXILIARY TANK IS TO MANUALLY TURN OFF VALVE ON AUXILIARY TANK.     IT IS VERY COMMON TO HAVE AUXILIARY FUEL TANK ON 1 TON HEAVY TRUCK. I WOULD LIKE TO SEE RAM GO BACK TO FUEL CAP OR REDESIGN CURRENT VALVE.

ON 1/17/2017 I TOOK MY 2016 RAM 3500 INTO THE SELLING DEALER SERVICE DEPARTMENT (DWAYNE LANE'S EVERETT, WA) TO CHECK FOR THE CAUSE OF A "CHECK TRAILER WIRING" VISUAL AND AUDIBLE WARNING WHICH HAD BEEN PRESENT INTERMITTENTLY WITH BRAKE PEDAL APPLICATION SINCE SHORTLY AFTER PURCHASE OF THE VEHICLE (NEW). WHEN PRESENT, THE DEFECT WOULD OCCUR IF THE VEHICLE WAS STATIONARY OR IN MOTION, PARTICULARLY IN DAMP ROAD CONDITIONS.  THE DEALERSHIP SAID THAT, BECAUSE OF THE PRESENCE OF NON-FACTORY OPTIONS, THEY WOULD NOT WORK ON THE VEHICLE UNTIL IT WAS RETURNED TO STOCK CONDITION (MAGNUSON-MOSS WARRANTY ACT VIOLATION) BASED ON THE ADVICE OF CHRYSLER/FCA.  I THEN TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER WHO INSTALLED THE CAMPER WIRING, WHERE IT WAS DISCOVERED THE THE BLUE WIRE FROM THE BRAKE CONTROLLER TO THE FACTORY INSTALLED 7-PRONG PLUG WAS INSTALLED INCORRECTLY AT THE RAM FACTORY, CAUSING THE FAULT CODE AND A POTENTIAL MALFUNCTION OF THE TRAILER BRAKE SYSTEM.  SHOULD THE BRAKES ON A TOWED VEHICLE MALFUNCTIONED IN OPERATION, THERE IS THE VERY REAL POSSIBILITY OF LOSS OF CONTROL, INJURY OR DEATH TO OCCUPANTS AND BYSTANDERS.  I HAVE VIDEO OF THE FAULT TAKING PLACE BUT THE FILES ARE TOO LARGE TO ATTACH TO THIS EMAIL.

ON MAY 25 WE EXPERIENCED CATASTROPHIC BRAKE FAILURE WHILE BACKING OUR NEW 2016 5TH WHEEL TRAILER INTO OUR DRIVEWAY. THIS INCLUDED BACKING DOWN OUR HILL AND TURNING TO THE RIGHT INTO OUR DRIVEWAY.  THE ROAD WE LIVE ON IS A PRIVATE ROAD.     AFTER THE INCIDENT IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE BRAKE BOOSTER RETAINING CLIP WAS EITHER NOT INSTALLED OR WAS MISSING CAUSING THE BRAKE PEDAL ASSEMBLY TO COME APART FROM THE "BRAKE" BOOSTER ARM WHICH RESULTED IN OUR INABILITY TO OPERATE THE BRAKES OF OUR PICKUP OR 2016 TRAILER.      THIS INCIDENT CAUSED OVER $18000 IN DAMAGE TO THE TRAILER AND OUR PROPERTY.    THE INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO FIAT CHRYSLER AUTOMOBILE WHO INVESTIGATED.  THEY REPORTED THAT UPON "REVIEW THE INSPECTION REPORT ..."," WE ARE NOT LED TO BELIEVE THAT THE INCIDENT WAS DUE TO A MANUFACTURING RESPONSIBILITY.  THERFORE WE MUST RESPECTFULLY DECLINE ANY ASSISTANCE WITH THIS INCIDENT."    AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT WE HAVE NOT HAD THIS VEHICLE FOR THE PAST 2.5 WEEKS BUT MOST OF ALL ARE SHOCKED AT THEIR RESPONSE.    WE HAVE NOTED THAT CHRYSLER HAD RECALLED OVER 24,000 VEHICLES INCLUDING RAM TRUCKS BETWEEN 2010 AND 2013 FOR THE EXACT SAME ISSUE.    HOPEFULLY THIS WILL SPUR SOME ACTION ON THIS ISSUE.
